DataElement.preferredName: OPTN UNOS Transplant Waiting List Date
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Application date for the OPTN/UNOS transplant waitlist.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Organ Procurement and Transplantation Network United Network for Organ Sharing Liver Transplant Waiting List
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: The transplant network established by the U.S. Congress under the National Organ Transplant Act of 1984. It is a public-private partnership, linking all professionals involved in the national donation and transplantation system._The organization that administers the Organ Procurement and Transplantation Network under contract with the Health Resources and Services Administration of the U.S. Department of Health and Human Services._A triangular-shaped organ located under the diaphragm in the right hypochondrium. It is the largest internal organ of the body, weighting up to 2 kg. Metabolism and bile secretion are its main functions. It is composed of cells which have the ability to regenerate._A registry of patients awaiting an organ transplant.

ObjectClass.preferredName: Organ Procurement and Transplantation Network United Network for Organ Sharing
ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: The transplant network established by the U.S. Congress under the National Organ Transplant Act of 1984. It is a public-private partnership, linking all professionals involved in the national donation and transplantation system.:The organization that administers the Organ Procurement and Transplantation Network under contract with the Health Resources and Services Administration of the U.S. Department of Health and Human Services.

Concepts.definition: The transplant network established by the U.S. Congress under the National Organ Transplant Act of 1984. It is a public-private partnership, linking all professionals involved in the national donation and transplantation system.

The organization that administers the Organ Procurement and Transplantation Network under contract with the Health Resources and Services Administration of the U.S. Department of Health and Human Services.

Property.preferredDefinition: A triangular-shaped organ located under the diaphragm in the right hypochondrium. It is the largest internal organ of the body, weighting up to 2 kg. Metabolism and bile secretion are its main functions. It is composed of cells which have the ability to regenerate.:A registry of patients awaiting an organ transplant.

Concepts.definition: A triangular-shaped organ located under the diaphragm in the right hypochondrium. It is the largest internal organ of the body, weighting up to 2 kg. Metabolism and bile secretion are its main functions. It is composed of cells which have the ability to regenerate.
A registry of patients awaiting an organ transplant. (ACC)

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: trial-specific criteria that a patient must meet to be enrolled.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The date on which an observation was made or an event occurred.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: a particular day specified as the time something has, or will, happen.

Concepts.definition: The particular day, month and year an event has happened or will happen.
